use-AzureAD.psm1 module provides easy to use cmdlets to manage your Azure AD tenant with a focus on Administrative Unit objects.

{{Fill adminUPN Description}}

maml:description.maml:para: Get Administrative Units with hidden membership

Get Administratives Unit with hidden membership. Only members of the admin unit can see the Admin Unit members. Azure AD user account with advanced roles (Global reader, global administrator..) can still see the Admin Unit members.

-public boolean choose if you want to display Administrative Unit with hidden membership or public membership
-inputobject Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.AdministrativeUnit Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.AdministrativeUnit object (for instance created by Get-AzureADAdministrativeUnit)
-public boolean choose if you want to display Administrative Unit with hidden membership or public membership

maml:description.maml:para: Get all changes from a delta view for an Azure AD object

Get all changes from a delta view for an Azure AD object. A delta view for an Azure AD object must be created first with New-AzureADObjectDeltaView. It can be used on several objects (groups, users, administrative units...) to retrieve change information occured between two moments (properties updated/removed/added, objects updated/removed/added). A maximum of 30 days changes can be retrieved.

maml:Description.maml:para: -inputobject PSCustomObject PSCustomObject generated previously with New-AzureADObjectDeltaView cmdlet
-inputobject PSCustomObject PSCustomObject generated previously with New-AzureADObjectDeltaView cmdlet

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXEMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get all updates from an initial delta view for manager and department properties of fb01091c-a9b2-4cd2-bbc9-130dfc91452a and 2092d280-2821-45ae-9e47-e9433a65868d users objects previously saved in $delta

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new Azure AD security dynamic group
Create a new Azure AD security dynamic group and set its membership rule

maml:Description.maml:para: -DisplayName String Displayname of the new group
-Description String Description of the new group

-MembershipRule string Membership rule (string) of the new dynamic group. More info about rule definition here : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/groups-dynamic-membership
-DisplayName String Displayname of the new group
-Description String Description of the new group

-MembershipRule string Membership rule (string) of the new dynamic group. More info about rule definition here : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/groups-dynamic-membership

command:example.dev:code: Create a new dynamic group Dynam_test5 with a membership rule based on user extensionAttribute9 value "test"

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new delta view for an Azure AD object

Create a new delta view for an Azure AD object. It can be used on several objects (groups, users, administrative units...) to retrieve change information occured between two moments (properties updated/removed/added, objects updated/removed/added). This cmdlet create the initial view (available at server side for 30 days maximum) and the cmdlet Get-AzureADObjectDeltaView will retrieve the changes occured between the first view creation.

maml:Description.maml:para: -ObjectType String {"Users","Groups","AdministrativeUnits"} target object type you want to use for the delta view
-SelectProperties String - array of strings object properties you want to watch, by default all properties will be followed
-FilterIDs String - array of strings object GUID you want to watch, by default all object from the object type selected will be followed
-ObjectType String {"Users","Groups","AdministrativeUnits"} target object type you want to use for the delta view
-SelectProperties String - array of strings object properties you want to watch, by default all properties will be followed
-FilterIDs String - array of strings object GUID you want to watch, by default all object from the object type selected will be followed

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXEMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Create an initial delta view for manager and department properties of all users objects

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXEMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Create an initial delta view for manager and department properties of fb01091c-a9b2-4cd2-bbc9-130dfc91452a and 2092d280-2821-45ae-9e47-e9433a65868d users objects

maml:description.maml:para: Update properties of an existing Azure AD security dynamic group
Update properties of an existing Azure AD security dynamic group, including processing state of the rule.

maml:Description.maml:para: -inputobject Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.Group Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.Group generated previously with Get-AzureADGroup cmdlet
-ObjectID Guid Guid of an existing Azure AD Group object
-NewDisplayName String Displayname of the new group
-NewDescription String Description of the new group

-NewMembershipRule string Membership rule (string) of the dynamic group. More info about rule definition here : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/groups-dynamic-membership
-DisableRuleProcessingState Switch Disable processing state of the current rule
-EnableRuleProcessingState Switch Enable processing state of the current rule
-inputobject Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.Group Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.Group generated previously with Get-AzureADGroup cmdlet
-ObjectID Guid Guid of an existing Azure AD Group object
-NewDisplayName String Displayname of the new group
-NewDescription String Description of the new group

-NewMembershipRule string Membership rule (string) of the dynamic group. More info about rule definition here : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/groups-dynamic-membership
-DisableRuleProcessingState Switch Disable processing state of the current rule
-EnableRuleProcessingState Switch Enable processing state of the current rule

maml:description.maml:para: Set a web proxy to connect to Azure AD graph API
Set / remove a proxy to connect to your Azure AD environment using AzureADPreview module or this module. Can handle anonymous proxy or authenticating proxy.

maml:Description.maml:para: -Proxy uri Set the proxy settings to URI provided. Must be provided as a valid URI like http://proxy:port

-ProxyCredential Management.Automation.PSCredential must be use with Proxy parameter Set the credential to be used with the proxy to set. Must be provided as a valid PSCredential object (can be generated with Get-Credential)
-DirectNoProxy Swith Remove proxy set, set to "direct" connection

-ProxyUseDefaultCredentials Swith must be use with Proxy parameter Set the credential to be used with the proxy to set. this switch will tell the system to use the current logged in credential to be authenticated with the proxy service.
-DirectNoProxy Swith Remove proxy set, set to "direct" connection
-Proxy uri Set the proxy settings to URI provided. Must be provided as a valid URI like http://proxy:port

-ProxyCredential Management.Automation.PSCredential must be use with Proxy parameter Set the credential to be used with the proxy to set. Must be provided as a valid PSCredential object (can be generated with Get-Credential)

-ProxyUseDefaultCredentials Swith must be use with Proxy parameter Set the credential to be used with the proxy to set. this switch will tell the system to use the current logged in credential to be authenticated with the proxy service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXEMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Remove Proxy

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXEMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set a local anonymous proxy 127.0.0.1:8888

maml:description.maml:para: Create new Azure AD Administrative Unit based on on premise AD Organizational Unit
Create new Azure AD Administrative Unit based on on premise AD Organizational Unit. Can be used to synchronize all existing on prem AD root OU with new cloud Admin unit.

maml:Description.maml:para: -RootOUFilterName string must be used with AllRootOU parameter Set a "like" filter to synchronize only OU based on a specific pattern. For instance "TP-*" to synchronize only OU with a name starting with TP-

-OUsDN string / array of string must not be used with AllRootOU parameter. you must choose between these 2 parameters. string must be a LDAP Distinguished Name. For instance : "OU=TP-VB,DC=domain,DC=xyz"
-AllRootOU Switch Synchronize all existing OU to new cloud Admin Unit (except default OU like Domain Controllers)
-AllRootOU Switch Synchronize all existing OU to new cloud Admin Unit (except default OU like Domain Controllers)

-RootOUFilterName string must be used with AllRootOU parameter Set a "like" filter to synchronize only OU based on a specific pattern. For instance "TP-*" to synchronize only OU with a name starting with TP-

-OUsDN string / array of string must not be used with AllRootOU parameter. you must choose between these 2 parameters. string must be a LDAP Distinguished Name. For instance : "OU=TP-VB,DC=domain,DC=xyz"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXEMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Create new cloud Azure AD administrative Unit for each on prem' OU found with a name starting with "TP-"

dev:remarks.maml:para: The verbose option can be used to write basic message on console (for instance when an admin unit already existing) C:\PS> Sync-ADOUtoAzureADAdministrativeUnit -AllRootOU -RootOUFilterName "TP-*" -Verbose

maml:description.maml:para: Add Azure AD user account into Azure AD Administrative Unit based on their on premise LDAP Distinguished Name
Add Azure AD user account into Azure AD Administrative Unit based on their on premise LDAP Distinguished Name.

maml:Description.maml:para: -CloudUPNAttribute string On premise AD user account attribute hosting the cloud Azure AD User userprincipal name. For instance, it could be also the userPrincipalName attribute or mail attribute.

-RootOUFilterName string must be used with AllRootOU parameter Set a "like" filter to synchronize only OU based on a specific pattern. For instance "TP-*" to synchronize only OU with a name starting with TP-

-OUsDN string / array of string must not be used with AllRootOU parameter. you must choose between these 2 parameters. string must be a LDAP Distinguished Name. For instance : "OU=TP-VB,DC=domain,DC=xyz"
-AllRootOU Switch Synchronize all existing OU to new cloud Admin Unit (except default OU like Domain Controllers)
-CloudUPNAttribute string On premise AD user account attribute hosting the cloud Azure AD User userprincipal name. For instance, it could be also the userPrincipalName attribute or mail attribute.
-AllRootOU Switch Synchronize all existing OU to new cloud Admin Unit (except default OU like Domain Controllers)

-RootOUFilterName string must be used with AllRootOU parameter Set a "like" filter to synchronize only OU based on a specific pattern. For instance "TP-*" to synchronize only OU with a name starting with TP-

-OUsDN string / array of string must not be used with AllRootOU parameter. you must choose between these 2 parameters. string must be a LDAP Distinguished Name. For instance : "OU=TP-VB,DC=domain,DC=xyz"

dev:type.maml:name: None. verbose can be used to display message on console.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXEMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add Azure AD users to administrative unit based on their source Distinguished Name, do it only for users account with a DN containing a root OU name starting with "TP-"

dev:remarks.maml:para: The verbose option can be used to write basic message on console (for instance when a user is already member of an admin unit) C:\PS> Sync-ADUsertoAzureADAdministrativeUnitMember -CloudUPNAttribute mail -AllRootOU -RootOUFilterName "TP-*" -Verbose
